items.body: Closes #7008

items.title: Fix a problem in FX about param position assumption
items.body:
The FX unit assumed &FxStorage == &FxStorage->type in one spot, which it had since epoch, but with the addition of a member at the top of the class, that assumption broke, and blammeroonie.

So do three things

1. Fix that assumption in SurgeFXProcessor
2. Move the new member to the end of the class just in case. Like we need to clean up the rack client which may do the same. And
3. Add a big honkin comment explaning this

Closes #7052

items.title: Vst3 plugin error: not configured to have stereo output

labels.name: User Support Request
labels.description: Issues where users are looking for help, not development items

items.body:
Hi after this https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/issues/7050,
i removed the lv2 plugin and inserted instead the vst3 plugin using with carla on my Arch Linux.
When i load the plugin on Carla i receive this error:

"Bus configuration error Surge XT was not configured to have stereo output, which is required. The main output bus has 0 channels ans is disable"

I didn't receive any error with lv2.

Sure is something related with configuration that i don't know. Thanks!

items.title: What shall i do after compiling lv2 package on Arch

labels.name: User Support Request
labels.description: Issues where users are looking for help, not development items

items.body:
Hi to all,

and thanks for this great synth.
I'm configuring my digital workstation with some software and i want to test surge.
I'm running arch linux with pipewire and pipewire jack clients.
I wanted to test some synth so i decided to test also vst3 plugin in Carla. When i find your synth i discovered that there was an lv2 version so i compiled it with cmake.

```
git clone https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge.git
cd surge/
git submodule update --init --recursive
cmake -Bbuildlv2 -DSURGE_BUILD_LV2=TRUE
cmake --build buildlv2 --config Release --target surge-staged-assets
```


```

[100%] Linking CXX shared module "surge-fx_artefacts/Release/LV2/Surge XT Effects.lv2/libSurge XT Effects.so"
surge-fx: Relocating LV2 component
[100%] Built target surge-fx_LV2
[100%] Built target surge-fx_Packaged
[100%] Built target surge-staged-assets
```
Now what can i do? I have to copy the compiledi directory in `usr/share` or in the lv2 dir plugin which carla use to scan plugins?
Where is the lv2 plugin?
Where can i have to copy the assets?

Sorry for this question, but this is the first time i compiled some software from source with cmake
Thanks

items.title: Tuning editor - editing number of notes

labels.name: UI
labels.description: Issues related to UI look&feel

labels.name: Tuning
labels.description: Non-standard tuning extensions

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: Item submitted using the Bug Report template

items.body:
**Bug Description:**
If I change the 'number of degrees' line in the tuning editor, then when a note is played, the editor highlights the wrong note in the text, and plays the old scale length.

**Surge XT Version**
Version: Surge XT 1.2.nightly.cb11acd
Build: 2023-04-09 @ 23:14:19 on 'fv-az33-642/pipeline' with 'MSVC-19.29.30148.0' using JUCE 6.1.6
System: Windows 64-bit Standalone on Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-7700HQ CPU @ 2.80GHz
Sample Rate: 44.1 kHz / Process block size: 32 samples

**Reproduction Steps:**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Drag "SD2 10-05.scl" into Surge
2. Open the editor
3. Decrement the degree count (e.g. from 5 to 4)
4. Delete the first ratio, leaving 4 entries.
5. Play notes. They highlight correctly in the VK (based on MIDI IN) at the left of the tuning editor, but the sound is a 5-note scale (should be 4), and the wrong notes highlight in the editor.

**Expected Behavior:**
When I play the notes, I expect those entries to be highlighted.

**Additional Information:**
I'm debugging my own app that generates .scl files, and came across this bug. I can reproduce it with the .scl files provided with Surge, so provided that as a clean example and avoid external factors.

items.title: Migrate additional AlertWindows to new UI
items.body: Also added onCancel function for Alerts and alertYesNo alias as was discussed in previous pull requests.

items.title: Host params are not updated when moving filter analysis XY pad
items.body:
Fixes #7044
and implementation of undo/redo for XYControl widget in Filter Analysis

items.title: Various parameter and naming adjustments for Bonsai
items.body:
Bass Distort is now in 0-100%
Bias Filter modes now don't mention "type x"
Dist Mode is now called Type with nice user-friendly names
Noise Gain is not asymmeteric nor extendable anymore
Input and output gain are both just named Gain to comply to other Surge effects
Removed two custom ctypes and replaced them with existing ones instead
Moved Bonsai to the first place in the Distortion effect group in the menu

labels.description: Issues related to DAW (host) automation

labels.name: Bug Report

milestone.title: Surge XT 1.3
milestone.description: We thought we'd have 1.2.1 perhaps but it didn't happen, and then PhilS came and started working on OSC, so we have it as a big feature to form a whole new release around it!

items.body:
**Bug Description:**
Them moving the point in FilterAnalysis window it affects the sound, but it doesn't update the parameters in plugin's host.
Checked as VST3 and CLAP. 



**Surge XT Version**

* Version:1.2.0
* Plugin Type: [VST2, VST3, AU, CLAP]
* Bitness: [64-bit]

**Reproduction Steps:**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Add Surge as VST2 plugin. 
2. Open Filter Analysis window
3. Move the point to apply cutoff filter
4. Observe that filter is working, but the host doesn't see the VST params are changed 

**Expected behavior:**
We should see the VST params of filter are also changed in the host so that we can control automation correctly, for example.

**Screenshots:**
![GIF Recording 2023-06-05 at 7 33 04 PM](https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/assets/31346594/d978821a-0d5e-45e3-8ae3-9e4e58f1f29d)

items.title: More explicit PI32 bail out; tweak README

items.title: Update README (and a CMake if) for RPi and LV2/Juce 7
items.body: Mostly documentation but also change the buildLV2 condition to be more robust now we have Juce 7.

items.title: Migrate no icon alerts in SurgeGUIEditor and add OverlayUtils for drawing windows
items.body:
Following up on https://github.com/surge-synthesizer/surge/pull/7037 
Moving a couple more alertOkCancels to the custom overlay and adding utility for the code to draw the window as discussed in the above pull request. Having the Alert and MiniEdit overlays use this - though subsequently other overlays may use this as well. My preference for the implementation of this is as a utility method, but I'm happy to add an abstraction layer instead if you prefer. We could also add more common code for buttons etc to this in the next PRs.

Questions:

1. Thoughts on standardizing between "Ok"/"Cancel" and "Yes"/"No" for these? This PR uses only the former - if we want to definitely allow both, I'll update this PR. 
2. Could you point me to how to test all the changes for this? I love this synth but I am new to it so I've never used the functionality this PR edits. 

Additionally - I'll be travelling starting tomorrow mid-day Seattle/US time and will be back Monday. So it will be difficult for me to contribute during this time. Next week however, I should be able to continue work on this and look at some of the short circuit work pointed to in discord.

items.title: Save per-instance MTS-ESP disconnect in DAW extra state

labels.name: Feature Request
labels.description: New feature request

labels.name: UI
labels.description: Issues related to UI look&feel

labels.name: Tuning
labels.description: Non-standard tuning extensions

milestone.title: Surge XT 1.3
milestone.description: We thought we'd have 1.2.1 perhaps but it didn't happen, and then PhilS came and started working on OSC, so we have it as a big feature to form a whole new release around it!

items.body:
William Fields requested this on Discord in order to have drum Surges not change when the tuning changes (but still make use of normal pitch bend so keytrack disabling is no good). It could be useful in other situations too surely, so why not. 

Proposal: Besides passing the necessary info to DAW extra state, rename the "disconnect as client..." option to "Ignore MTS-ESP for this instance" and give that a checkmark. That should hopefully help clarify the difference between the global and local option.

labels.name: Bug Report

items.body:
**Bug Description:**
Surge XT crashes Host (Reaper) when using dark skin. VST3 and LV2, same problem. Default skin works fine. This problem occurs only with the Plugins. The App version handles skins without problem.
So in Reaper I load a new instance of Surge on a new track. I can open and close without a problem. But as soon as I try to change to the dark skin and I close and try to reopen, the Host crashes.

items.title: fix: include correct headers for gcc 13
items.body:
Due to changes in upstream [gcc][0], surge no longer builds from source (a.k.a. FTBFS).

This patch adds the required headers throughout the project, thankfully it is only one location!

[0]: https://gcc.gnu.org/gcc-13/porting_to.html#header-dep-changes

milestone.title: Surge XT 1.x
milestone.description: Things we could do in the 1.x family but didn't make 1.2 or 1.3

items.body:
**Bug Description:**
When clicking a control - button, slider - the mouse cursor is hidden - I guess this might be intended for sliders (?). When releasing the mouse cursor does not re-appear. At the moment, the mouse cursor has to be moved out of the plugin window in order to re-appear.

**Surge XT Version**
* Version: 1.2.3bb8dd2b
* Plugin Type: AU
* Bitness: 64-bit

**Reproduction Steps:**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Click ( mouse down ) on a button or a slider
2. Move the mouse cursor at least a pixel
3. Mouse cursor is hidden
4. Release the mouse button ( mouse up )
5. Mouse cursor stays hidden

**Expected Behavior:**
Mouse cursor should re-appear after releasing the mouse / mouse-capture.

**Computer Information (please complete the following!):**
 - OS: macOS Ventura 13.3.1 ( on Apple Silicon M2 )
 - Host: Logic Pro X
 - Version: 10.7.7

items.title: AMP EG - too fast???
items.body:
Hi, having questions about the Amp EG in the standalone version 

Version: Surge XT 1.2.git-no-branch.git-no-commit
Build: 2023-04-12 @ 00:00:00 on 'hci-snode2-m0/local' with 'GNU-13.0.1' using JUCE 6.1.6
System: Linux 64-bit Standalone on  Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-8700 CPU @ 3.20GHz
Sample Rate: 44.1 kHz / Process block size: 32 samples

I am trying to reverse engineer the Factory Pad "Canadians" into the VCV Rack version. After not getting the same 'noise' between the two synths I noticed that the standalone version does something 'weird'. The AMP EG has an attack value of ~1.5secs. But as soon as I press a note on the keyboard the volume is nearly max immediately.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14888092/236718946-af04ee54-b9a2-4d10-b9d3-2caa0a0a7b07.mp4

Whereas in my Rack equivalent I get an attack time I expect -

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14888092/236720149-04e24ff2-1c11-47b2-bfa7-4bab3ed08c47.mp4

Either the attack on the standalone's AMP EG is wrong OR I am misunderstanding the signal path in Surge and my VCV patch is wrong. I have read the manual's technical stuff (honestly!) but I am curious as to why the standalone attck is so fast.

items.title: Surge / Surge-XT attack resolution from MIDI controller Nektar impact LX49+

labels.name: MIDI
labels.description: MIDI support related

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: Item submitted using the Bug Report template

milestone.title: Surge XT 1.3
milestone.description: We thought we'd have 1.2.1 perhaps but it didn't happen, and then PhilS came and started working on OSC, so we have it as a big feature to form a whole new release around it!

items.body:
**Bug Description:**
Attack resolution is only 1 bit when MIDI control is assigned to controller CC#38

**Surge XT Version**
1.2.2.832c875

* Version:
* Plugin Type: [VST3]
* Bitness: [64-bit]

**Reproduction Steps:**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Right click on the Attack controller in the Filter EG section and learn from MIDI controller.
2. On Nektar Impact LX49+, use the first slider (called attack)


**Expected Behavior:**
A expect the slider to travel from bottom to top in correspondence to the controller.  It does not.  It only moves 1 bit, from 0 to 1.  I have confirmed the controller itself is fine as my DAW (Renoise) can see full 128 bit resolution coming from the same physical control.

items.title: String Excitation using FM source

labels.name: Feature Request
labels.description: New feature request

labels.name: DSP
labels.description: Issues and feature requests related to sound generation in the synth

labels.name: Oscillator
labels.description: Features or additions to the oscillator section

milestone.title: Surge XT 1.x
milestone.description: Things we could do in the 1.x family but didn't make 1.2 or 1.3

items.body:
Just joined the monthly Linnstrument zoom call

Idea came up which was: can we use other oscillators as a string exciter

The way to do this is to add two more exciter modes

1. FM-as-exciter
2. FM-as-exciter-and-FM

In mode 1, the FM input would excite but not frequency modulate the string
In mode 2, the FM input would excite and would frequency modulate the string

Then you could do custom excitations bu modulating FM depth in 2>1 mode

I want to play with this and see if it sounds like garbage before we ship it but its too interesting an idea to not write down

milestone.title: Surge XT 1.3
milestone.description: We thought we'd have 1.2.1 perhaps but it didn't happen, and then PhilS came and started working on OSC, so we have it as a big feature to form a whole new release around it!

items.body:
To jog your memory

- Surge < 1.2.0 block size not multiple of 32, corrupted audio, no warning, no resolution
- Surge > 1.2.0 block size not multiple of 32, make input latent, don't corrupt but
     - 1.2.0 - splash a massive modal error on the screen whether you use it or not
     - 1.2.1 - draw a small warning over every osc whether the osc uses it or not
     - 1.2.2 - draw a small warning over the audio in oscillator and nowhere else

Clearly there's some goldilocksing happening here. What we want in 1.3 is the 1.2.2 solution but also:

- [x] For Alias oscillator if Audio In mode is selected
- [x] For String oscillator if Audio In mode is selected
- [x] For Vocoder effect... *somewhere*

The primary goal of the 1.2.x was to avoid the massive modal screen; these tweaks can wait until a 1.3.

items.title: Replace all dB-based Width params in all FX with %-based one

labels.name: Feature Request
labels.description: New feature request

labels.name: DSP
labels.description: Issues and feature requests related to sound generation in the synth

labels.name: Breaking Change
labels.description: In order to close this issue we need to make a breaking change (no backwards compatibility)

milestone.title: Surge XT 2.0
milestone.description:
Next level Surge!

This milestone presents a solid book of work we have slated for the next major Surge XT release, after the initial one we have released in Jan 2022.

items.body:
Currently, all effects with Width slider (except Conditioner) use a pretty uncommon (and just wrong sounding) dB-based Width slider which adjusts the volume of the side component of the signal. Trouble is, this slider goes +/-24 dB, which is far too much of a swing as it's really easy to heavily distort the signal when going above 0 dB.

Proposal: break this completely in XT2 and change the behavior so that side component is adjusted linearly in +/-2 range (with 1 being the default). The parameter type should change from `ct_decibel_narrow` to `ct_percent_bipolar200` and a call to `storage->db_to_linear()` when setting the width param value can then be removed.

items.title: ParamMetaData and new FX

labels.name: Code Refactoring

milestone.title: Surge XT 1.3
milestone.description: We thought we'd have 1.2.1 perhaps but it didn't happen, and then PhilS came and started working on OSC, so we have it as a big feature to form a whole new release around it!

items.body:
Still left to do here

- [ ] temposync (quite pressingly since flanger and r1 are currently broken)
- [ ] absolute
- [ ] extend scales 
-----

The new FX (and presumably in the future the new OSC) have `set::basic_blocks::params::ParamMetaData` to describe the params.

So imagine if this added a few things like `canDeactivate` `canExtend` etc... and also added `withUnits` and then `std::string toString(f)` and `optional<float> fromString(const std::string &)` methods

then `Parmeter` can pick up a `std::optional<ParamMedatData>`which is set to `{}` every time you call `set_type` but is reset to the PMD in the post-init-ctrltypes param metadata copy in the FX (and in the future the OSC) and then to_string and from_string could move here.

Similarly with modulation depths.

You get the idea.

items.title: Osc->init ignored octave; commit changes sound.
items.body:
SurgeVoice called osc->init with a pitch which ignored the octave offset and so forth. This meant that the first block of any oscillator with octave +3 would have a 3 octave immediate shift.

This long lived bug (since inception) is audible in the String and (far less so) Modern oscillators which have a variety of memory and smoothing in their handling of pitch.

This will subtly change the sound of oscillators with high octaves, but will change it to be correct.

Closes #6985

items.body: If you set an osc to string, and adjust its pitch using either scene or osc controls, the osc pitch seems to be initialized with the untransposed pitch and has to ramp to the correct one. Eg. Raising the osc pitch by 3 octaves sounds very different from transposing the incoming midi data. In my testing, no other osc types exhibited this behavior.

items.title: setting portamento time to 0ms stilll produces pitch slides in single trigger play modes

labels.name: Modulation
labels.description: Modulation related issues

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: Item submitted using the Bug Report template

milestone.title: Surge XT 1.3
milestone.description: We thought we'd have 1.2.1 perhaps but it didn't happen, and then PhilS came and started working on OSC, so we have it as a big feature to form a whole new release around it!

items.body:
If a portamento time of 0ms is used, and the scene play mode is set to one of the single trigger options, there is still a subtle slide between notes. This slide is absent when using non single trigger play modes i.e. 0ms is truly instantaneous, but it of course does not quite sound the same as single trigger.

I first noticed this with linear curve and all other portamento options unchecked. I was advised by a user on the Discord to try checking constant rate and using logarithmic curve shape, since in their testing at least, this was a bit better. However, all settings will still produce a slide. Furthermore very large note jumps (a few octaves or more), have longer slides with constant rate checked than unchecked, even if the portamento time is kept at 0ms.

At first I thought this was a design limitation of the oscillators, and for string and modern types this indeed seems to be the case as they will quickly ramp/slide when performing pitch change by any means. However all other osc types can be forced into extreme, non-ramped pitch changes with lfos, or modulation from CC (if midi smoothing is disabled), so most oscs seem capable of instant portamento.

items.title: The tuning problem: XT2 plans

labels.name: Tuning
labels.description: Non-standard tuning extensions

milestone.title: Surge XT 2.0
milestone.description:
Next level Surge!

This milestone presents a solid book of work we have slated for the next major Surge XT release, after the initial one we have released in Jan 2022.

items.body:
The tuning of a given note can be resolved either by calculating frequency(key + modulation) or frequency(key) + modulation. Presently, Surge will use one out of these two behaviors across the board always, user selectable as "Apply tuning at MIDI input" vs. "Apply tuning after modulation".

For the user this basically translates into: "pitch parameters/modulations set constant offsets which apply equally to all notes" vs: "pitch parameters/modulations set offsets which cleverly follow the loaded scale". No difference at all while you stay in 12-equal, but any other scale this makes a big difference.

There is also the question of whether frequency offsets are resolved in log2-space (jives well with human musical perception, creates consistent harmonic relations, or linear space (for inharmonic bell-like funtimes etc), which we also want to support.

These things are working ok for us now, but there are some situations that we can't yet resolve in a satisfying way, leading us to consider updating the tuning api in the oscillators (and filters and anything else that's tuneable) to have not one, but three points of entry: Fixed log2 Offset, Scale-Bound log2 offset, Linear Offset. 

This + the openness to breaking changes might let us improve some UI/UX around tuning in XT2, and this issue is meant to be a list of potential improvements. 

- [ ] Make the before/after option local, so you can have a microtuned sequencer being pitch bent with constant offset or other combinations like that. This will require some thought to not make the UX too complex. But seems like it'd be worth pursuing. 

- [ ] Make the oscillators play the scale 1/1 when keytrack is disabled.

- [ ] Make oscillator pitch dial a bit more predictable in "after modulation" mode (at least with respect to the 1/1), by making the degrees of the loaded scale appear on the dial in the same place they would if the same interval were typed in in "apply before" mode. For unequal scales, this assumes 0=the scale 1/1. The user needs understand they won't necessarily hear the same offsets from every MIDI key, which is ok maybe? For equal scales other than 12-edo, this would just be nice though, since it would simply mean the max reach of the param in pitch is the same whether your scale has 12 notes/octave or 34. 

- [ ] Let octave dials offset by the scale repetition interval instead of 2/1. But optionally, so you can do things like 2/1 offsets in Bohlen-Pierce scales.

items.title: Adjustable delay between strings 1 & 2 in String osc

labels.description: New feature request

labels.name: Oscillator
labels.description: Features or additions to the oscillator section

labels.name: Requires Param List Change
labels.description: To accomplish this issue we need to be able to modify the DAW params in all our hosts

milestone.title: Surge XT 2.0
milestone.description:
Next level Surge!

This milestone presents a solid book of work we have slated for the next major Surge XT release, after the initial one we have released in Jan 2022.

items.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe!**

No

A clear and concise description of what the problem is. e.g. I'm always frustrated when [...]

It would be good to be able to adjust the delay between strings 1 and 2 in the string oscillator. This would allow simulation of instruments with a pair of strings tuned to the same or similar pitch, such as a mandolin.

**Describe the solution you'd like:**
A clear and concise description of what you want to happen.

I'd like to see the addition of a control that would delay the onset of string 2. This control should also be tempo sync-able.

**Describe alternatives you've considered:**
A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered.

It's possible to achieve this now with dual mode, string osc in both scenes, taking away string 2 in both cases by putting string balance to 0, then adding a delay with no feedback on scene B.

**Additional context:**
Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.

I've been told by several users in the Discord that this isn't possible currently, but that it may be possible in XT2.

milestone.title: Surge XT 1.3
milestone.description: We thought we'd have 1.2.1 perhaps but it didn't happen, and then PhilS came and started working on OSC, so we have it as a big feature to form a whole new release around it!

items.body:
Bring up two modern saw oscs, and load any unequal tuning with scl (kbm not necessary).

Make one of them absolute pitch, but keep its pitch at 0. 

Play some different notes. You'll hear the root of the scale is perfectly in tune, but there's a small amount of beating on others, indicating that absolute mode makes the osc interpret tuning very slightly wrong. Note that this happens even in "apply tuning at MIDI input" mode.

items.title: Pitch type-ins are a tiny bit borked with "Apply tuning after modulation"

labels.name: Tuning
labels.description: Non-standard tuning extensions

labels.name: UX
labels.description: Issues related to user experience (UX) - mouse, touch, keyboard, MIDI inputs, etc.

milestone.title: Surge XT 1.3
milestone.description: We thought we'd have 1.2.1 perhaps but it didn't happen, and then PhilS came and started working on OSC, so we have it as a big feature to form a whole new release around it!

items.body:
So... you have loaded a tuning with a 3/2 in it, and checked the mentioned option. You type-in "3/2" in the pitch field of an oscillator, it won't play 3/2. 

That's because with apply after modulation checked, putting pitch to 7.00 exactly is remapped to 7 keys up, and typing in 3/2 doesn't land you on 7 steps it lands you on ≈7.02. 

So you probably expected to land on 3/2 since that's what you typed in, and that interval is in your scale. But instead you landed a bit sharp of the 7th degree in your scale. How sharp depends on what the 8th degree is, since this mode interpolates the pitches between the integer degrees.

There are two options for solving this. Either we just document it as it is, basically saying "in this mode, always type in pitch offsets as 100 cent intervals. 

...or make it so whenever the user types in a ratio that's present in the scale, make sure the param ends in the place that actually makes that sound. 

The latter would be more intuitive in some cases. But of course, it'd still only be when playing the root of the scale that you'd actually be guaranteed to hear the interval you typed in.

items.title: Yet more code churned into the shared bucket
items.body:
1. lag<> moves to basic-blocks
2. lipol<> moves to basic-blocks (but still not lipol_ps)
3. More unused headers either bite the dust or just go to simple using statements

items.title: Reorder PatchDB operations on rename
items.body:
The patcdb rename would look like save / delete / update but the save had a patch db update in it of course. So the delete on unix would delete underneath the patch importer and the importer is not robust under that condition (#6973). Fixing that is hard, so rather than fix that today open an issue for it and instead have the rename look like save+update / drain queue / delete+update and then no more lock.

Closes #6959

items.title: Articulations (choose a macro set)

labels.name: Feature Request
labels.description: New feature request

labels.name: Modulation
labels.description: Modulation related issues

milestone.title: Currently Unscheduled
milestone.description: We put issues in this milestone if they are not currently scheduled in our book of work. This doesn't mean we won't do them - it just means we haven't put them in a plan yet.

items.body:
This feature seems likely to exist in other synths, and someone more experienced than me could cut through this long description and just point to its name :)

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe!**
As a sound designer, encouraged to make patches with macros, I'd like to make the patches more useful to users, by directing them to different useful 'sweet spots' that the patch offers. Users would then more quickly be able to explore the possibilities of a patch, or reset macros to preset/useful values.

**Describe the solution you'd like:**
If Surge offered **Articulations** (or some other name) in a menu, then users could select those to bulk-select macro values, or even store their own within the patch. Ideally (and by default anyway?) these macro changes are recorded in the DAW, if armed.

For example, as a designer, I could list out several piano configurations, like 'lively', 'felt', 'filtered', 'hammers', 'bass', 'ambient', and so on.

The UI might be challenging: Selection (surface UI), and then (deeper menu) Add, Delete, Rename for Articulations, and [stretch goal] Edit, to toggle whether each macro is changed by selection of the articulation.

More than macros?: not for MVP. Setting, say, parameters, is effectively a macro and wouldn't be transparent for the user; the answer for this use case is "more macros".

**Describe alternatives you've considered:**
It's possible to save them as separate patches, at the cost of fragmenting the different variants.

**Additional context:**
Con: As a designer, it's more challenging to hold all the articulations together, than it is to design specialist patches.
Con: If designers had included Articulations, and then change the main patch parameters, then it's a burden to recalibrate the Articulations.
Con: If a patch is able to cross categories with different Articulations, then it's hard to categorize (as a designer) and hard to find (as a user). For example, if a Keys instrument could be made to sound 'bowed', then users won't find the bowed variant easily because the main patch is in Keys.

items.body:
**Bug Description:**
Oneshot Factory WTs are no longer oneshots after moving to assuming 1024 frames when loading a WAV file without loop metadata.

**Surge XT Version**
Version: Surge XT 1.2.main.d57eed25
Build: 2023-04-17 @ 23:02:03 on 'rainbow/local' with 'Clang-15.0.7' using JUCE 6.1.6
System: Linux 64-bit VST3 on  AMD Ryzen 7 2700X Eight-Core Processor
Host: Ardour @ 96.0 kHz / Process block size: 8 samples

**Reproduction Steps:**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Select a WT oscillator
2. Load Factory Wavetables -> Oneshot -> [any of them]
3. Notice it's not a oneshot anymore, but a WT with 1024 frames.

**Expected Behavior:**
Oneshots are still oneshots.

**Additional Information:**
A proper fix for importing WAVs without loop information is issue #3436 but until then we should patch the factory files to have the correct metadata.

This will allow us to start porting FX and Oscillators to decouple from SurgeStorage. Still have to do SC

items.title: Rename user preset appears database lock error

labels.name: Bug Report
labels.description: Item submitted using the Bug Report template

milestone.title: Surge XT 1.3
milestone.description: We thought we'd have 1.2.1 perhaps but it didn't happen, and then PhilS came and started working on OSC, so we have it as a big feature to form a whole new release around it!

items.body:
1. Rename a user preset and save
2. The error appears: PatchDB - Loading Favorites SQL Error[5]. Database is locked (This Error appears two times immediataly)
3. After confirm, the preset is finally renamed
4. If i want to perform now the following i got the same error: PatchDB - SQL Error[5]. Database is locked (without the "Loading Favorites"), and this time up to 20+ times immediataly, that i have to confirm now
- save a new preset, delete a preset, favorite a preset
- again after confirming all the errors, the action was performed, and i see the favorite, the preset is deleted or a new is created!
- Refresh patch browser doesn't help
- Restart the surge standalone session or the DAW host helps and all actions can performed without an error as long as no preset rename is performed! Then the error appears again for all the actions above!

* Version: Linux x64 Verison 1.1.2, 1.2.0, and the nightly downloaded on 2023.04.18
* Plugin Type: VST3, Clap, LV2 in Reaper and Standalone

 - OS: openSUSE Tumbleweed 20230413, amd64
 - Host: Reaper 6.73
- Another User has the same issue in Arch Linux too.

items.title: Implement the CLAP remote control pages
items.body:
For now just 5 pages; macros and the mixer and filters from each. But I'm sure we could add more if people like it

Addresses #6930
